channel.title: Travisci on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: Into the matrix with Travis CI
item.description: Travis CI is a continuous integration tool, a description which means nothing to people who have never used it. “Continuous integration” is one of these industry phrases that doesn’t serve to illuminate the problem that it describes. Why would you care? Well, you’re working on a project with a bunch of other people, and it’s kind of complicated. It might depend on some old code that’s fragile and should be tested all the time when it changes, or it might depend some brand-spanking new code that doesn’t quite work and you know it doesn’t work yet but you want the test system to be less tedious.
